section.name: Welcome to the SOD Ingredient Reference!
section.p: The ingredient reference contains a page for every ingredient that can go into SOD. If you want to extend and improve your SOD runs, it's the place to find pieces of SOD that do what you want.

section.name: What is an Ingredient?
section.p: A ingredient is a single operation in SOD. A SOD recipe file consists of multiple ingredients that tell SOD how to gather and process data.

section.name: What's in each ingredient's page?
section.p: Each ingredient's page consists of four major sections: a description of the ingredient's uses, an example of the ingredient's structure, an abstract description of the ingredient's structure, and a list of all of the ingredients that contain this ingredient.

section.name: Description
section.p: Each page starts with the name of the ingredient followed by its description. The description contains a general idea of what the ingredient does, common usages, and references to other ingredients that use this one.

section.name: Example
section.p: The example shows what an instance of this ingredient looks like. You can copy the example, paste it in the correct place in a recipe file, and SOD will start using it. It can help to see a base usage of a ingredient to modify it for your own purposes.

section.name: This consists of
section.p: This section describes the exact structure of the current ingredient. It's important enough to get its own page explaining it here.

section.name: Places this can be found
section.p: This section lists every ingredient that contains this ingredient. In the case where this is contained in a choice, the items that can be substituted for this are listed as well.

section.name: How do I find the Ingredient I want?
section.p: So you've got a SOD recipe file that does most of what you want, but you need to refine the data or add another processing step. How do you find the right ingredient to insert to get the work done? The menu that runs down the left side of all of the Ingredient Reference pages consists of links to each of the ingredient pages for the major steps in SOD's operations broken down by arm. If you can identify the step that needs to be refined, just select that one out of the menu and find the appropriate ingredient. Lets say the events SOD returns past a certain distance aren't worth processing. Since the problem is solely with the events, that means the event arm needs to be tweaked. After clicking on Origin in the eventArm section of the menu, scanning the various pieces that can go there reveals originPointDistance. By adding an originPointDistance with a small max distance value to the eventArm keeps SOD from processing events that are far away.
